content.description: Start right of the black water streak and follow bolts up to a chain anchor on a nice ledge.  From here, head up and left to anchors in the alcove at the base of the cave.  Can easily be combined into one pitch (and probably should).  A nice little multi-pitch with a view at the top, and a cool cave to explore.
content.location: Right of the black water streak.  Starts in a lovely shaded alcove that sees almost no sun.

content.description: From the difficult to spot anchor on the low slab, follow bolts up and left, through a notch just right of a small tower.  Continue trending inexplicably left though crummy rock, and then eventually head up to the top of the formation.  Anchors are over the ledge and out of sight.  If you've come this far, sit and enjoy the view.  A 70 meter will get you down to the mossy 3rd class slab just above the anchors.  Which you are going to have to free solo anyways to get your rope back, after it inevitably gets stuck when you pull it.  Not really worth it unless you are extremely bored.
content.location: From the anchors at the opening of the alcove, turn left and head up the cobble fins to your left. After about 50ft, there are two rings in the rock to belay from.
